titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the I. I. Serebrennikov papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Paul Karpuk

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-09-13T15:54-0700

change.item: Revised to update extent statement to reflect existence of boxes 1A, 4A, 12A, 17A.
Revised to update encoding by Jill Golden.
Updated to add additional item information in box 7, updated encoding to one dsc.

PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Ivan Innokentievich Serebrennikov Papers)//EN" "serebrii.xml" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Diaries, correspondence, writings, photographs, clippings, and notebooks relating to the Russian Civil War in Siberia, Russian émigrés in the Far East, and Chinese history and culture. Also available on microfilm (33 reels).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], I. I. Serebrennikov papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1951.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Studied at Military Medical Academy, St.Petersburg
Arrested in connection with Socialist Revolutionary organization
Municipal Secretary for town of Irkutsk

eventgrp.event: Director for the Affairs of the East Siberian Section of the Imperial Russian Geographical Society
Vice-Chairman of local Committee of the Union of Towns in Irkutsk
Delegate from Irkutsk City Duma to All-Russian Food Congress
Representative of Zemgor at Siberian Factories Conference
Member of Siberian (later All-Russian) Government at Omsk
Minister of Supply for Siberian Government, acting chairman of Council of Ministers in absence of P. V. Vologodsky
Head of Delegation of Siberian Government to State Conference of Ufa; Vice-Chairman of Conference

chronitem.event: Member of Institute to Study Siberia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Diaries, correspondence, writings, photographs, clippings, and notebooks relating to the Russian Civil War in Siberia, Russian émigrés in the Far East, and Chinese history and culture. Also available on microfilm (33 reels).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Diaries in bound notebooks containing diary entries, photographs, newspapers and magazine clippings, and handwritten drafts of poems and essays by Ivan I. and Alexandra N. Serebrennikov (wife of Ivan Innokentievich Serebrennikov), arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence of Alexandra N. and Ivan I. Serebrennikov, arranged alphabetically by last name of correspondent or name of organization.

did.unittitle: Notebook of copies and drafts of letters sent in English,
Notebooks containing lists of letters sent,
Antudevich, Z. I. and I. A.,
Batourin, A. O., Mr. and Mrs.,
Damskii Kruzhok Dal'nevostochnavo Rossiiskavo Doma (Ladies' Circle of the Far Eastern Russian Home),
Dom Miloserdiia vo Imia Prep. Serafima Sarovksavo (The Reverend Serafim Sarovskii Charity Home),
Egoroff, A. A. and K. F.,
Erwin, E. S. (Assistant Comptroller, Stanford University),
Institut Iapono-Russkavo Obshchestva (Institute of the Russian-Japanese Society),
Kunis, Zelma M. and I. S.,
Nachal'nik Kantseliarii Glavy Russkoi Emigratsii Na Dal'nem Vostoke (Head of the Office of the Chief of Russian Emigration in the Far East),
National City Bank of New York,
Obshchestvennaia Deshevaia Stolovaia (Low-Priced Public Dining Room),
Obshchestvo Izucheniia Man'chzhurskavo Kraia (Society for the Study of Manchuria),
Obshchestvo Sibiriakov v Kharbine (Society of Siberians in Harbin),
Pervaia Rossiiskaia Gimnaziia v Tian'tszinie (First Tientsin Russian High School),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence from Rossiikaia gimnaziia v g. Dairenie.

did.unittitle: Pervaia Russkaia Tian'tszinskaia Smieshannaia Progimnaziia (First Russian Co-educational School in Tientsin),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes invitation from Tientsin Grammar School.

did.unittitle: Pravlenie Zarubezhnoi Stanitsy Irkutskavo Kazach'iavo Voiska (Directorate for the Foreign Village of Irkutsk Cossack Troops),
Russkii Zagranichnyi Istoricheskii Arkhiv v Prage (Russian Historical Archives Abroad--in Prague),
Serebrennikov, Alexandra N., (letters from Ivan I. to Alexandra N. Serebrennikov)
Serebrennikov, Ivan I., (letters from Alexandra N. to Ivan I. Serebrennikov)
Vyslanectvi Republiky Ceskoslovenske v Cine (Legation of the Czechoslovak Republic),
Zverev, O. L., and I. F.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Writings by Alexandra N. and Ivan I. Serebrennikov, including typewritten and handwritten drafts, typewritten carbon and mimeographed copies, and printed copies of poems, articles, plays, and books, arranged alphabetically by title; newspaper clippings or articles; notebooks containing handwritten drafts of articles and poems, arranged chronologically; and translations, arranged alphabetically by title.

did.unittitle: Drafts and printed copies of articles, books, plays, and poems,
"Apostol Foma v Indii" (The Apostle Thomas in India),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typewritten draft, two typewritten carbon copies

did.unittitle: "Aziia--Kolybel' Pervichnoi Kul'tury" (Asia--Cradle of the First Civilization),
"Den' Russkoi Kul'tury v Budushchem Rossiiskom Gosudarstvie" (Russian Culture Day in the Russia Yet to Come),
"Dieti i Dietskoe Slovotvorchestvo" (Children and the Creation of Words by Children),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typewritten mimeographed copy, includes English translation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typewritten mimeographed copy, three printed copies

did.unittitle: "Dvukhsotilietie Russkoi Poezii" (Two Hundred Years of Russian Poetry),
"Ekonomicheskoe Polozhenie S.S.S.R." (The Economic Situation in the U.S.S.R.),
"Epigrammy, Shutki i Parodii" (Epigrams, Jokes and Parodies),
"A Great Retreat: Wanderings and Scatterings of the Russian White Armies in Northern and Central Asia,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typewritten carbon copy, includes Russian translation

did.unittitle: "The Historical Trend of Russian Policy in and Towards Outer Mongolia and Manchuria Including Eastern Inner Mongolia,"
"Hunting Trophies in the Wilderness of Manchuria,"
"Iz Besied Konfutsiia s Laotsy" (From Confucius Conversations with Lao-Tse),
"Iz Skazok Azii" (From the Folk-Tales of Asia),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handwritten drafts, typewritten mimeographed and carbon copies, includes English translation

did.unittitle: "Iz Tian'tszinskoi Stariny" (From an Old Man of Tientsin),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typewritten carbon copy, two printed copies

did.unittitle: "Khudozhestvennyi Al'bom 'Vostochnavo Obozrieniia'" ( Eastern Review's Artistic Album),
"K Istorii Azii, Tom 2" (On Asian History, vol. 2),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typewritten drafts, typewritten carbon and mimeographed copies, printed copies

did.unittitle: "K Istorii Izucheniia Sievero-Vostoka Azii" (On the Historiography of Northeast Asia),
"K Istorii Russkavo Natsional'navo Gimna" (On the History of the Russian National Anthem),
"K Istorii Sibirskavo Pravitel'stva" (On the History of the Siberian Government),
"Kitaiskie Narodnye Verovaniia, Pover'ia i Nekotorye Obychai" (Chinese Popular Beliefs, Superstitions, and Several Customs),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typewritten carbon copy, two printed copies

did.unittitle: "Kniga o Tekushchikh Sobytiiakh" (A Book About Current Events),
"K Voprosu o Biudzhetnykh Issledovaniiakh v Kitae" (On the Question of Budgetary Studies in China),
"K Voprosu o Shamanizme v Kitae" (On the Question of Shamanism in China),
"Liudskaia Sila, Kak Sredstvo Trasporta v Kitae"(Manpower as a Means of Transportation in China),
"Liudskie Opustosheniia v Kitae" (Human Destruction in China),
"Moi Vstrechi s Atamanom A. I. Dutovym" (My Encounters with Ataman A. I. Dutov),
"Nado Znat' Istoriiu Rodnoi Zemli" (You Should Know the History of the Motherland),
"Na Polie Bitvy" (On the Field of Battle),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typewritten mimeographed copy, two printed copies

did.unittitle: "O Budushchem Sibirskavo Oblastnichestva" (The Future of Siberian Autonomy),
"Ocherk Ekonomicheskoi Geografii Kitaia" (Survey of the Economic Geography of China),
"O Kul'tie Mertvykh" (On the Cult of the Dead),
"O Nedochetakh Russkikh Uchebnikov Istorii" (On the Deficiencies in Russian History Textbooks),
"O Propoviedi Khristianstva v Kitae v Pervye Vieka Nashei Ery" (On the Propagation of Christianity in China in the First Century of Our Era),
"O Russkom Iazykie, evo Iskazheniiakh i Slovotvorchestvie" (On the Russian Language, its Distortions and Word-Creation),
"O Shkol'nom i Vysheshkol'nom Vospitanii i ob Ulichnykh Dietiakh" (On School and High-School Education and Children Out on the Street),
"O Tvorchestvie Chekhova" (On the Works of Chekhov),
"Pamiati D. P. Pershina" (D. P. Pershin: In Memoriam),
"Pamiati Generala G. E. Katanaeva" (General G. E. Katanaev: In Memoriam),
"Pamiati Professora S. M. Shirokogorova" (Professor S. M. Shirokogoroff: In Memoriam),
"Ploty iz Bordiukov po Riekie Khuan-Khe" (Rafts from Wineskins on the Hwang Ho River),
"Podkhodit i k Rossii" (It Also Suits Russia),
"Pokhozhdeniia Moritsa Benevskavo" (The Adventures of Morris Benevsky),
"Posliednii Podvig 'Bielavo Generala'" (The Last Exploit of the "White General"),
"Posliendii Put' Admirala Kolchaka" (The Last Journey of Admiral Kolchak),
"Prazdnik Piatoi Luny" (The Festival of the Fifth Moon),
"Pristanishche Starovo Guliaki" (Shelter for an Old Reveler),

"Puteshestvie v 1863 Godu Nasliednika Tsesarevicha Nikolaia Aleksandrovicha po Oblasti Voiska Donskavo" (The Travels of the Tsarevitch Nikolai Aleksandrovich in the Region of the Don Cossacks in the Year 1863),
"Rost Russkavo Zemledieliia v Trekhriech'ie" (The Growth of Russian Agriculture in the Three Rivers Region),
"Russians on the Amur Territory in the XVII Century,"
"Russkaia Zhenshchina v Mirovuiu Voinu" (A Russian Woman in the World War),
"Russkie v Man'chzhurii v Srednie Vieka" (Russians in Manchuria in the Middle Ages),
"Russkie Pokhody na Indiiu" (Russian Campaigns to India),
"Sanovnik i Drovosiek" (The Official and the Woodcutter),
"Sherstianoe Proizvodstvo v Kitae" (Wool Production in China),
"The Siberian Autonomous Movement and Its Future,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typewritten draft, two typewritten carbon copies

did.unittitle: "Sibirskaia Relikviia v Pekinie" (A Siberian Relic in Peking),
"Skotovodstvo Vneshnei Mongolii i evo Ressursy" (Pasturage Capacity of Outer Mongolia),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

"Van Tsiun, Fatalist i Skeptik" (Wan Tsun, Fatalist and Skeptic),
"Vilikaia Legenda: Imperator Aleksandr I i Starets Fedor Kuz'mich" (A Great Legend: Emperor Alexander I and the Elder Fedor Kuz'mich),
"Velikaia Vystavka v Lintunie" (The Great Exhibition in Lintun),
"V Khrame Neba" (At the Temple of Heaven),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two typewritten mimeographed copies, includes English translation

did.unittitle: "Vozstanie Poliakov za Baikalom v 1866 Godu" (The Rising of the Poles on the Baikal in 1866),
"V Stranie Uchtivykh Liudei" (In the Land of Courteous People),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typewritten carbon copy. Apparently an introduction to an unfinished work on the Revolution and Civil War in Russia.

did.unittitle: "Zhenshchina v Russkikh Poslovitsakh i Pogovorkakh" (The Woman in Russian Proverbs and Expressions),
Newspaper clippings of published articles by Alexandra N. and Ivan I. Serebrennikov,
Notebooks containing handwritten drafts of articles and poems by Alexandra N. and Ivan I. Serebrennikov,
"Iz Etiudov Chzhan Chao" (From Sketches by Chzhan-Chao),
"Iz Iaponskoi Poezii: Sbornik" (From Japanese Poetry: A Collection),
"Iz Nipponskoi Poezii: Sbornik Stikhotvorenii" (From Japanese Poetry: A Collection of Poems),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typewritten drafts, typewritten carbon and mimeographed copies

did.unittitle: "Kitaiskaia Poeziia: Sbornik Stikhotvorenii" (Chinese Poetry: A Collection of Poems), volumes I and II,
"Kreshchenie Sv. Vladimira" (The Christening of St. Vladimir) by Karl Gavlichek,
"Tsvety Iaponskoi Poezii" (The Flowers of Japanese Poetry),
"Tsvety Kitaiskoi Poezii" (The Flowers of Chinese Poetry),
"Tsvety Nipponskoi Poezii: Sbornik Stikhotvorenii" (From Nippon Poetry: A Collection of Poems),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, newspaper clippings, bulletins, pamphlets, charts, manuscripts of books, printed matter, and notebooks, arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Antikommunisticheskii Komitet Rossiiskikh Emigrantov v Severnov Kitaie (Anticommunist Committee of Russian Emigrants in Northern China),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handwritten notes from various books and articles on China

did.unittitle: Gantimuroff, N. P., Prince, Zabytyi Tsarevich,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: One handwritten and typewritten draft, one handwritten copy

did.unittitle: Grand Fleet Battle Orders, manual of British naval tactics used by Admiral Sir John Jellicoe, translated into Russian,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 2 volumes, typewritten copy (signed by Admiral Kolchak)

did.unittitle: Guins, George C., Prof., Politika Prava (Legal Policy),
Obshchestvo Sibiriakov v Chekhoslovatskoi Respublike (Society of Siberians in the Czechoslovak Republic), bulletin,
Russkii Zagranichnyi Istoricheskii Arkhiv v Prage (Russian Historical Archives Abroad--In Prague),
Staryi Peterburg (Old Petersburg), author unknown, handwritten extracts
White Russian armies in the Far East,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Banknotes, calendar, calling cards, certificates of residence, documents, financial records, greeting cards, invitations, maps, membership cards, memorabilia, memorandum book, newspapers, passports, receipts, scrapbooks, and glass negatives, arranged as listed.

did.unittitle: Banknotes: Russia, pre-Revolutionary and Revolutionary eras; China
Documents, correspondence and newspaper article commemorating the 40th anniversary of the literary activity of Ivan I. Serebrennikov (1941)
Documents commemorating the 950th anniversary of the Christianization of Russia (1938)
Scrapbook containing autographs, letters, photos, and postcards

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes signatures of Rimsky-Korsakov, Rabindranath Tagore, Grigorii Rasputin, Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaievitch, Admiral Kolchak, General Baron Peter von Wrangel, Maxim Gorky, and others.

did.unittitle: 1 album with photos of Russian soldiers in the Carpathians during World War I,
1 album with photos of White Russian soldiers and officers during the Civil War in Siberia and the Urals, and of Admiral A. V. Kolchak,
1 album with photos of atrocities committed during the Civil War in Siberia and the Urals,

1 album with photos of I. I. and A. N. Serebrennikov, Russian refugees in China, the Russian Orthodox Mission in Peking, Admiral A. V. Kolchak, Dmitrii Khorvat, and Chinese temples and buildings; and with photocopies of paintings by P. J. Safonoff depicting the Civil War in Siberia and the Urals,
1 album with photos of Lieutenant-General Baron Peter N. Wrangel's funeral in Belgrade,
1 album with photos of Western Siberia, general,
1 album with photos and illustrations of statues and buildings in China, the Russian Orthodox Mission in Peking, the Empress Tzu-Hsi, and the Emperor Kuang-Hsu
1 album with photos of A. N. and I. I. Serebrennikov, and statues and buildings in China,
1 album with photos of statues and buildings in China,
1 album with postcards depicting street scenes in Harbin, Mukden, Port Arthur, and Dairen (Manchuria); Tientsin, Peking, and Tsingtao (China); and Kyoto (Japan)
1 album with photos of Tientsin during the flood of 1939 and White Russian soldiers in China,
1 album with photos of buildings and landscapes in China and Manchuria,
1 album with photos of buildings and landscapes in China, Chinese Army officers and soldiers, Marshal Feng Yu-hsiang, and Chang Tso-lin
1 album with photos of buildings and landscapes in China, Chinese dramatic artists, and Chinese Army officers
1 album with postcards depicting buildings and landscapes in China
1 album with photos of A. N. and I. I. Serebrennikov and the sea-resort at Peitaiho (China),
1 album with photos of buildings and people in Tientsin, Peking, Dairen, and Calgon,
1 album with photos of statues, buildings, people and landscapes in Peitaiho and Peking,
1 album with photos of A. N. and I. I. Serebrennikov, Russian refugees in China, and the sea-resort at Peitaiho,
1 album with photos of statues, buildings, and landscapes in Tientsin, Peking, and Mongolia,
1 album with photos of Tientsin during the flood of 1939, foreign troops in China, and the invasion of Manchuria by the Japanese (1931-1933)
1 album with photos of Chinese soldiers during the civil war,
1 album with photos of Chinese funerals,
1 album with photos of buildings and landscapes in Outer Mongolia
1 album with photos and postcards depicting Irkutsk, Trans-Baikal, and Kyoto (Japan)
1 album with photos of people, buildings, and landscapes in Tibet
1 album with photos of Russian Orthodox Mission in Peking and Russian refugees in China,
1 album with photos of A. N. and I. I. Serebrennikov and Russian refugees in China,
1 album with photos of A. N. and I. I. Serebrennikov, Russian refugees in China, and Admiral A. V. Kolchak,
1 mounted photo of I. I. Serebrennikov with members of the Council of Elders of the Russian Public Assembly in Tientsin; 1 photo of I. I. Serebrennikov,
16 mounted illustrations of the wives of Mongol Emperors
1 mounted photo of a Chinese temple
2 mounted photos of the Chinese dramatic artist Mei Lan-fan
12 postcards depicting temples and landscapes in Japan
1 photo-portrait of A. V. Kolchak; 2 photos of Admiral Kolchak addressing White Russian troops on the front during the Civil War in Siberia,
31 photographs of troops and other individuals in Siberia and China at the time of the Russian Civil War
